answers.answer: Hi,Good morning. There can be many causes of pins and needles sensation like excessive stress, anxiety, diabetes, hypothyroidism, alcoholism, vitamin deficiency, lyme disease, circulatory disorders like an atherosclerotic plaque, TIA, neurological ones like neuropathy, MS, and motor neuron disease.The treatment will depend on the cause. I can understand your anxiety but to make an exact diagnosis you need further tests.Please let me know if you need any more information and do keep me posted. Take care!
Dear DrThank you so much for your promtp response - you made no mention of the inflamation on the brain? could this also be linked to one of the other conditions as you describe?thank youregardsToni

Hi,Inflammatory disorders of the brain include brain abscess, meningitis, encephalitis and vasculitis. Since you do not have high fever and neck rigidity meningitis can be ruled out. It is quite possible that you are suffering from mild viral encephalitis. A CSF examination by lumbar puncture will help in diagnosis.The results of your LP should shed some light on the cause of your symptoms. When are you expecting them? Do keep me posted.

Thank you for your answer - I am expecting them only on Wed. I was very frustrated that we could not get them earlier and do not understand the delay as if its a serious condition surely one needs to move asap? I understand the NHS are very busy but I would like to know what it is so that treatment can begin - very worried I will never feel "normal" again. I hope its this encephalitis as I am so healthy and fit and it is really so upsetting that suddenly my brain is inflamed. The numbness and pins and needles is fairly stong - well I can only be positive and also if it is MS then there are lots of drugs out there to help me lead a relatively normal life, so I am told.thank you so much - take care
